section.content: The amount, if any, paid or payable as purchase money in cash, shares or debentures for any property to which paragraph 12 applies, specifying the amount, if any, payable for goodwill.

section.name: s14
section.content: The amount, if any, paid within the 2 preceding years, or payable, as commission (but not including commission to sub-underwriters) for subscribing or agreeing to subscribe, or procuring or agreeing to procure subscriptions, for any shares in or debentures of the company, or the rate of any such commission.

section.name: s15
section.content: The amount or estimated amount of preliminary expenses and the persons by whom any of those expenses have been paid or are payable, and the amount or estimated amount of the expenses of the issue and the persons by whom any of those expenses have been paid or are payable.

section.name: s16
section.content: Any amount or benefit paid or given within the 2 preceding years or intended to be paid or given to any promoter, and the consideration for the payment or the giving of the benefit.

section.name: s17
section.content: The dates of, parties to and general nature of every material contract, not being a contract entered into in the ordinary course of the business carried on or intended to be carried on by the company or a contract entered into more than 2 years before the date of issue of the prospectus; and a statement that a copy of every such material contract has been delivered to the Registrar for registration.

section.name: s18
section.content: The names and addresses of the auditors, if any, of the company, and, if the prospectus invites the public to subscribe for debentures which are stated in the prospectus to be guaranteed, the names and addresses of the auditors, if any, of the guarantor corporation.

section.name: s19
section.content: Full particulars of the nature and extent of the interest, if any, of every director in the promotion of, or in the property proposed to be acquired by, the company, or, where the interest of such a director consists in being a partner in a firm, the nature and extent of the interest of the firm, with a statement of all sums paid or agreed to be paid to him or to the firm in cash or shares or otherwise by any person either to induce him to become, or to qualify him as, a director, or otherwise for services rendered by him or by the firm in connexion with the promotion or formation of the company.

section.name: s20
section.content: If the prospectus invites the public to subscribe for shares in the company and the share capital of the company is divided into different classes of shares, the right of voting at meetings of the company conferred by, and the rights in respect of capital and dividends attached to, the several classes of shares respectively.

section.name: s21
section.content: In the case of a company which has been carrying on business, or of a business which has been carried on for less than 3 years, the length of time during which the business of the company or the business to be acquired, as the case may be, has been carried on.

section.name: s22
section.content: The contents or a sufficient summary of the contents of the articles of the company with regard to any borrowing powers exercisable by the directors and the manner of variation of such powers.

section.name: s23
section.content: Particulars of any bank overdrafts or other similar indebtedness of the company and its subsidiaries, if any, as at the latest practicable date or, if there are no bank overdrafts or other similar indebtedness, a statement to that effect.

section.name: s24
section.content: Particulars of any hire purchase commitments, guarantees or other material contingent liabilities of the company and its subsidiaries, if any, or, if there are none such, a statement to that effect.

section.name: s25
section.content: Particulars of the authorized debentures of the company and its subsidiaries, if any, the amount issued and outstanding or agreed to be issued, or if no debentures are outstanding a statement to that effect.

section.name: s26
section.leadIn: If the prospectus invites the public to subscribe for debentures of the company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the rights conferred upon the holders thereof, including rights in respect of interest and redemption, and particulars of the security, if any, therefor;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the designation of such debentures which shall incorporate—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: in the case of debentures not secured by a charge on assets of the company—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the word “unsecured” if the designation is in English;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the expression in Chinese “無保證” if the designation is in Chinese; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: both such word and expression respectively if the designation is both in English and Chinese; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: in the case of debentures secured to a substantial extent by a specific mortgage or charge—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the word “mortgage” if the designation is in English;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the expression in Chinese “按揭” if the designation is in Chinese; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: both such word and expression respectively if the designation is both in English and Chinese; (Replaced 3 of 1997 s. 57)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: particulars of any guarantee subsisting in respect of the debentures, including the name and address of the guarantor, and the designation or any description of the debentures shall only incorporate the word “guaranteed” or the expression in Chinese “獲擔保” if they are guaranteed to a substantial extent by a legally enforceable guarantee. (Replaced 3 of 1997 s. 57)

section.name: s27
section.content: A statement as to the gross trading income or sales turnover (as may be appropriate) of the company during each of the 3 financial years immediately preceding the issue of the prospectus including an explanation of the method used for the computation of such income or turnover, and a reasonable break-down between the more important trading activities; but a bank, discount house or other company whose business is in the opinion of the directors of a character that such a statement is either not practicable or not of value may instead include an explanation of the absence of such a statement.

section.name: s28
section.leadIn: If the prospectus offers shares in the company for sale to the public—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the names, addresses and descriptions of the vendor or vendors of the shares, or, if there are more than 10 vendors, the like particulars of the 10 principal vendors and a statement of the number of other vendors;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: particulars of any beneficial interest possessed by any director of the company in any shares so offered for sale.

section.name: s29
section.content: The name, the date and place of incorporation (and if the company has, after its incorporation, changed its place of domicile on one or more occasions, its place of domicile on each occasion and the date on which that place became its place of domicile), the general nature of the business, the issued capital and the proportion of the issued capital held or intended to be held, of every company, whether public or private (if applicable), the whole of the capital of which or a substantial proportion thereof is held or intended to be held, or whose profits or assets make or will make a material contribution to the figures in the auditors’ report or to the next financial statements of the company.

section.name: s30
section.content: A statement of the persons holding or beneficially interested in any substantial part of the share capital of the company and the amounts of the holdings in question.

part.name: PII
part.heading: Reports to be set out

subsection.leadIn: A report by the auditors of the company with respect to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: profits and losses and assets and liabilities of the company in accordance with sub-paragraph (2) or (3), as the case required; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the rates of the dividends, if any, paid by the company in respect of each class of shares in the company in respect of each of the 3 financial years immediately preceding the issue of the prospectus, giving particulars of each such class of shares on which such dividends have been paid and particulars of the cases in which no dividends have been paid in respect of any class of shares in respect of any of those years,

subsection.continued: and, if no financial statements have been prepared in respect of any part of the period of 3 years ending on a date 3 months before the issue of the prospectus, containing a statement of that fact.

subsection.leadIn: If the company has no subsidiaries, the report shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: so far as regards profits and losses, deal with the profits or losses of the company in respect of each of the 3 financial years immediately preceding the issue of the prospectus; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: so far as regards assets and liabilities, deal with the assets and liabilities of the company at the last date to which the financial statements of the company were prepared.

subsection.leadIn: If the company has subsidiaries, the report shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: so far as regards profits and losses, deal separately with the company’s (other than subsidiaries) profits or losses as provided by sub-paragraph (2) and, in addition, deal either—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: as a whole with the combined profits or losses of its subsidiaries; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: individually with the profits or losses of each subsidiary,

paragraph.continued: or, instead of dealing separately with the company’s profits or losses, deal as a whole with the profits or losses of the company and with the combined profits or losses of its subsidiaries; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: so far as regards assets and liabilities, deal separately with the company’s (other than subsidiaries) assets and liabilities as provided by sub-paragraph (2) and, in addition, deal either—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: as a whole with the combined assets and liabilities of its subsidiaries, with or without the company’s assets and liabilities; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: individually with the assets and liabilities of each subsidiary,

subsection.continued: and shall indicate as respects the profits or losses and assets and liabilities of the subsidiaries the allowance to be made for persons other than members of the company.

section.name: s32
section.leadIn: If the proceeds, or any part of the proceeds, of the issue of the shares or debentures are or is to be applied directly or indirectly in the purchase of any business, a report made by accountants (who shall be named in the prospectus) upon—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the profits or losses of the business in respect of each of the 3 financial years immediately preceding the issue of the prospectus; and (Amended 86 of 1992 s. 18)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the assets and liabilities of the business at the last date to which the financial statements of the business were prepared. (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subsection.leadIn: if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the proceeds, or any part of the proceeds, of the issue of the shares or debentures are or is to be applied directly or indirectly in any manner resulting in the acquisition by the company of shares in any other undertaking; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by reason of that acquisition or anything to be done in consequence thereof or in connexion therewith that undertaking will become a subsidiary of the company,

subsection.continued: a report made by accountants (who shall be named in the prospectus) upon—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the profits or losses of the other undertaking in respect of each of the 3 financial years immediately preceding the issue of the prospectus; and (Amended 86 of 1992 s. 18)

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the assets and liabilities of the other undertaking at the last date to which the financial statements of the undertaking were prepared. (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subsection.leadIn: The said report shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: indicate how the profits or losses of the other undertaking dealt with by the report would, in respect of the shares to be acquired, have concerned members of the company and what allowance would have fallen to be made, in relation to assets and liabilities so dealt with, for holders of other shares, if the company had at all material times held the shares to be acquired; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the other undertaking has subsidiaries, deal with the profits or losses and the assets and liabilities of the undertaking and its subsidiaries in the manner provided by paragraph 31(3) in relation to the company and its subsidiaries.

subsection.content: This paragraph shall apply in the case of every company whose financial statements at the last date to which the financial statements have been prepared disclose that either a value exceeding 10 per cent of the value of the assets of the company or a value of not less than $3,000,000 is placed on the company’s interests in land or buildings. (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subsection.leadIn: A valuation report with respect to all the company’s interests in land or buildings which shall include the following particulars of each property—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the address;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a brief description;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the use at the date of the report;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the nature of the tenure;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a summary of the terms of any sub-leases or tenancies, including repair obligations, granted by the company;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the approximate age of buildings;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the present capital value;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the estimated current net rental, being the estimated average net annual income from the property accruing to the company over a long period of years (not being less than 3 years) before taking into account tax and any interest or mortgage expenses but after taking into account management and maintenance expenses.

subsection.leadIn: A report for the purposes of sub-paragraph (2) shall state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: whether the valuation—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: is the current value in the open market, stating whether—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: on an investment basis, or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: on a development basis, or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: on a future capital realization basis;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is the current value as an asset of a going concern;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: is the value after development has been completed; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: has any other basis (which should be stated);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where the valuation is based on value after development has been completed—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the date when the development is expected to be completed;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the estimated cost of carrying out the development or (where part of the development has already been carried out) the estimated cost of completing the development; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the estimated value of the property in the open market in its present condition.

subsection.content: If the company has obtained more than one valuation report regarding any of the company’s interests in land or buildings within 6 months before the issue of the prospectus then all other such reports shall be included.

part.name: PIII
part.heading: Provisions applying to Parts I and II of Schedule

section.name: s35
section.content: Paragraphs 15 (so far as it relates to preliminary expenses) and 19 shall not apply in the case of a prospectus issued more than 2 years after the date at which the company began to carry on business.

section.name: s36
section.leadIn: Every person shall, for the purposes of this Schedule, be deemed to be a vendor who has entered into any contract, absolute or conditional, for the sale or purchase, or for any option of purchase, of any property to be acquired by the company, in any case where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the purchase money is not fully paid at the date of the issue of the prospectus;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the purchase money is to be paid or satisfied wholly or in part out of the proceeds of the issue offered for subscription by the prospectus;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the contract depends for its validity or fulfilment on the result of that issue.

section.name: s37
section.def: Where any property to be acquired by the company is to be taken on lease, this Schedule shall have effect as if the expression “vendor” included the lessor, and the expression “purchase money” included the consideration for the lease, and the expression “sub-purchaser” included a sub-lessee.

section.name: s38
section.content: References in paragraph 10 to subscribing for shares or debentures shall include acquiring them from a person to whom they have been allotted or agreed to be allotted with a view to his offering them for sale.

section.name: s39
section.content: For the purposes of paragraph 12 where the vendors or any of them are a firm, the members of the firm shall not be treated as separate vendors.

section.name: s40
section.content: If in the case of a company which has been carrying on business, or of a business which has been carried on for less than 3 years, the financial statements of the company or business have only been prepared in respect of 2 years or 1 year, Part II shall have effect as if references to 2 years or 1 year, as the case may be, were substituted for references to 3 years.

section.name: s41
section.def: The expression financial year (財政年度) in this Schedule means the year in respect of which the financial statements of the company or of the business, as the case may be, are prepared, and where by reason of any alteration of the date on which the financial year of the company or business terminates the financial statements of the company or business have been prepared for a period greater or less than a year, that period is for the purposes of this Schedule to be regarded as a financial year.

section.name: s42
section.content: Any report required by Part II shall either indicate by way of note any adjustments as respects the figures of any profits or losses or assets and liabilities dealt with by the report which appear to the persons making the report necessary or shall make those adjustments and indicate that adjustments have been made.

section.name: s43
section.def: Any report by accountants required by Part II shall be made by persons who are not prohibited under section 20AAZZR of the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council Ordinance (Cap. 588) from holding any appointment as auditors of a company and shall not be made by any accountant who is an officer or servant, or a partner of or in the employment of an officer or servant, of the company or of the company’s subsidiary or parent undertaking or of a subsidiary of the company’s parent undertaking; and for the purposes of this paragraph the expression officer (高級人員) shall include a proposed director but not an auditor.

section.name: s44
section.content: For the purposes of paragraph 6, the description of a person, that is to say, his profession, trade or other occupation shall be stated with particularity and precision; and the description “Company Director” shall be inadequate unless supplementary information is provided stating the nature of the relevant company’s business.

section.name: s45
section.def: For the purposes of this Schedule, address (地址) in the case of a natural person means the place of his usual residence.

section.name: s46
section.leadIn: Any valuation report required by Part II—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall not state or imply that any land or building has been professionally valued unless the valuation is made by a professionally qualified valuation surveyor who is subject to the discipline of a professional body;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not be made by a person who is an officer or servant or proposed director of the company or the company’s subsidiary or parent undertaking or of a subsidiary of the company’s parent undertaking; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: shall not be made by a company which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is the company’s subsidiary or parent undertaking or a subsidiary of the company’s parent undertaking; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has either a paid up capital of less than $1,000,000 or the assets of which do not exceed liabilities by $1,000,000 or more as shown in the company’s last balance sheet.

schedule.name: sch4
schedule.heading: Form of Statement in lieu of Prospectus to be delivered to Registrar by a Company which does not issue a Prospectus or which does not go to Allotment on a Prospectus Issued, and Reports to be set out therein
schedule.sourceNote: (Fourth Schedule replaced 78 of 1972 s. 21. Amended L.N. 187 of 1993; 83 of 1995 s. 23; Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

part.name: P1
part.heading: Form of Statement and Particulars to be contained therein

crossHeading.inline: COMPANIES (WINDING UP AND MISCELLANEOUS PROVISIONS) ORDINANCE

part.text:
Statement in lieu of Prospectus delivered for registration by
[Insert the name of the company]

crossHeading.inline: Pursuant to section 43 of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance

td.p: Delivery for registration duly authorized by (Insert the name of every director who has authorized and signed this Statement).
The amount of the issued share capital of the company.
Amount (if any) of above capital which consists of redeemable shares.
The earliest date on which the company has power to redeem these shares.
Names, descriptions and addresses of directors or proposed directors.

If the share capital of the company is divided into different classes of shares, the right of voting at meetings of the company conferred by, and the rights in respect of capital and dividends attached to, the several classes of shares respectively.
Number and amount of shares and debentures agreed to be issued as fully or partly paid up otherwise than in cash.
shares upon which $ per share credited as paid.
The consideration for the intended issue of those shares and debentures.

Number, description and amount of any shares or debentures which any person has or is entitled to be given an option to subscribe for, or to acquire from a person to whom they have been allotted or agreed to be allotted with a view to his offering them for sale.
Period during which option is exercisable.
Price to be paid for shares or debentures subscribed for or acquired under option.
Consideration for option or right to option.
Persons to whom option or right to option was given or, if given to existing shareholders or debenture holders as such, the relevant shares or debentures.

Names and addresses of vendors of property purchased or acquired, or proposed to be purchased or acquired by the company except where the contract for its purchase or acquisition was entered into in the ordinary course of the business intended to be carried on by the company or the amount of the purchase money is not material.
Amount (in cash, shares or debentures) payable to each separate vendor.
Amount (if any) paid or payable (in cash or shares or debentures) for any such property, specifying amount (if any) paid or payable for goodwill.

Short particulars of any transaction relating to any such property which was completed within the 2 preceding years and in which any vendor to the company or any person who is, or was at the time thereof, a promoter, director or proposed director of the company had any interest direct or indirect.
Amount (if any) paid or payable as commission for subscribing or agreeing to subscribe or procuring or agreeing to procure subscriptions for any shares or debentures in the company; or
The number of shares, if any, which persons have agreed for a commission to subscribe absolutely.
By whom those expenses have been paid or are payable.
Amount paid or intended to be paid to any promoter.
Any other benefit given or intended to be given to any promoter.

Dates of, parties to and general nature of every material contract (other than contracts entered into in the ordinary course of the business intended to be carried on by the company or entered into more than 2 years before the delivery of this statement).

Time and place at which the contracts or copies thereof may be inspected or (1) in the case of a contract not reduced into writing, a memorandum giving full particulars thereof, and (2) in the case of a contract wholly or partly in a language other than the official languages, a copy of a translation thereof in English or Chinese or embodying a translation in English or Chinese of the parts in a language other than the official languages, as the case may be, being a translation certified in the prescribed manner to be a correct translation.
Names and addresses of the auditors of the company (if any).

Full particulars of the nature and extent of the interest of every director in the promotion of or in the property proposed to be acquired by the company, or where the interest of such a director consists in being a partner in a firm, the nature and extent of the interest of the firm, with a statement of all sums paid or agreed to be paid to him or to the firm in cash or shares, or otherwise, by any person either to induce him to become, or to qualify him as, a director, or otherwise for services rendered by him or by the firm in connexion with the promotion or formation of the company.
(Signatures of the persons above-named as directors or proposed directors, or of their agents authorized in writing.)

part.name: P2
part.heading: Reports to be set out

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: Where it is proposed to acquire a business, a report made by accountants (who shall be named in the statement) upon—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the profits or losses of the business in respect of each of the 5 financial years immediately preceding the delivery of the statement to the Registrar; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the assets and liabilities of the business at the last date to which the financial statements of the business were prepared. (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subsection.content: Where it is proposed to acquire shares in an undertaking which by reason of the acquisition or anything to be done in consequence thereof or in connexion therewith will become a subsidiary of the company, a report made by accountants (who shall be named in the statement) with respect to the profits and losses and assets and liabilities of the other undertaking in accordance with sub-paragraph (2) or (3), as the case requires, indicating how the profits or losses of the other undertaking dealt with by the report would, in respect of the shares to be acquired, have concerned members of the company, and what allowance would have fallen to be made, in relation to assets and liabilities so dealt with, for holders of other shares, if the company had at all material times held the shares to be acquired.

subsection.leadIn: If the other undertaking has no subsidiaries, the report referred to in sub-paragraph (1) shall— (Amended 12 of 2005 s. 16)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: so far as regards profits and losses, deal with the profits or losses of the undertaking in respect of each of the 5 financial years immediately preceding the delivery of the statement to the Registrar; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: so far as regards assets and liabilities, deal with the assets and liabilities of the undertaking at the last date to which the financial statements of the undertaking were prepared. (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subsection.leadIn: If the other undertaking has subsidiaries, the report referred to in sub-paragraph (1) shall— (Amended 12 of 2005 s. 16)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: so far as regards profits and losses, deal separately with the other undertaking’s profits or losses as provided by sub-paragraph (2), and in addition deal either— (Amended 12 of 2005 s. 16)

subparagraph.content: as a whole with the combined profits or losses of its subsidiaries, so far as they concern members of the other undertaking; or
individually with the profits or losses of each subsidiary, so far as they concern members of the other undertaking;

paragraph.continued: or, instead of dealing separately with the other undertaking’s profits or losses, deal as a whole with the profits or losses of the other undertaking and, so far as they concern members of the other undertaking, with the combined profits or losses of its subsidiaries; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: so far as regards assets and liabilities, deal separately with the other undertaking’s assets and liabilities as provided by the last foregoing sub-paragraph and, in addition, deal either— (Amended 12 of 2005 s. 16)

subparagraph.content: as a whole with the combined assets and liabilities of its subsidiaries, with or without the other undertaking’s assets and liabilities; or
individually with the assets and liabilities of each subsidiary;

subsection.continued: and shall indicate as respects the assets and liabilities of the subsidiaries the allowance to be made for persons other than members of the company.

part.name: P3
part.heading: Provisions Applying to Parts I and II of this Schedule

section.name: s3
section.def: In this Schedule the expression vendor (賣主) includes a vendor as defined in Part III of the Third Schedule, and the expression financial year (財政年度) has the meaning assigned to it in that Part of that Schedule.

section.name: s4
section.content: If in the case of a business which has been carried on, or of an undertaking which has been carrying on business, for less than 5 years, the financial statements of the business or undertaking have only been prepared in respect of 4 years, 3 years, 2 years or 1 year, Part II shall have effect as if references to 4 years, 3 years, 2 years or 1 year, as the case may be, were substituted for references to 5 years.

section.name: s5
section.content: Any report required by Part II shall either indicate by way of note any adjustments as respects the figures of any profits or losses or assets and liabilities dealt with by the report which appear to the persons making the report necessary or shall make those adjustments and indicate that adjustments have been made.

section.name: s6
section.def: Any report by accountants required by Part II shall be made by accountants authorized under the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) for appointment as auditors of a company and shall not be made by any accountant who is an officer or servant, or a partner of or in the employment of an officer or servant, of the company or of the company’s subsidiary or parent undertaking or of a subsidiary of the company’s parent undertaking; and for the purposes of this paragraph the expression officer (高級人員) shall include a proposed director but not an auditor.

section.name: s7
section.content: For the purposes of Part I, the description of a person, that is to say, his profession, trade or other occupation shall be stated with particularity and precision; and the description Company Director shall be inadequate unless supplementary information is provided stating the nature of the relevant company’s business.

section.name: s8
section.def: For the purposes of Part I, address (地址) in the case of a natural person means the place of his usual residence.

schedule.name: sch17
schedule.heading: Offers Specified for the Purposes of Paragraph (b)(ii) of the Definition of Prospectus in Section 2(1) of this Ordinance

part.name: P1
part.heading: List of Offers, etc. Not Falling within Definition

section.name: s1
section.content: An offer to professional investors within the meaning of section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571)(including professional investors falling within paragraph (j) of the definition of professional investor in that section).

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: An offer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to not more than 50 persons; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: containing a statement specified in Part 3 of the Eighteenth Schedule to this Ordinance.

section.name: s3
section.leadIn: An offer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in respect of which the total consideration payable for the shares or debentures concerned shall not exceed the amount specified in Part 2, or its equivalent in another currency; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: containing a statement specified in Part 3 of the Eighteenth Schedule to this Ordinance.

section.name: s4
section.leadIn: An offer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in respect of which the minimum denomination of, or the minimum consideration payable by any person for, the shares or, in the case of debentures, the minimum principal amount to be subscribed or purchased, is not less than the amount specified in Part 3, or its equivalent in another currency; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: containing a statement specified in Part 3 of the Eighteenth Schedule to this Ordinance.

section.name: s5
section.content: An offer in connection with an invitation made in good faith to enter into an underwriting agreement.

section.name: s6
section.content: An offer in connection with a takeover or merger or a share buy-back which is in compliance with the Codes on Takeovers and Mergers and Share Buy-backs issued by the Commission as in force from time to time.

section.name: s7
section.leadIn: An offer of shares in a company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: made—

subparagraph.content: for no consideration, to any or all holders of shares in the company; or
as an alternative to a dividend or other distribution, to all holders of shares of a particular class in the company, provided the offer is of fully paid-up shares of the same class; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: containing a statement specified in Part 3 of the Eighteenth Schedule to this Ordinance.

section.name: s8
section.leadIn: An offer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of shares in or debentures of a company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to persons who are qualifying persons in respect of the company referred to in paragraph (a) or of another company which is a member of the same group of companies as the company referred to in that paragraph;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: by—

subparagraph.content: the company referred to in paragraph (a);
another company which is a member of the same group of companies as the company referred to in paragraph (a); or

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: of a trust established by any one or more of the companies mentioned in subparagraphs (i) and (ii); and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: holding the shares or debentures the subject of the offer;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: on terms that the only persons who can acquire the shares or debentures are the qualifying persons to whom they are offered or, if the terms of the offer so permit, any qualifying person; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: containing a statement specified in Part 3 of the Eighteenth Schedule to this Ordinance.

section.name: s9
section.leadIn: An offer by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a charitable institution or trust of a public character mentioned in section 88 of the Inland Revenue Ordinance (Cap. 112); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an educational establishment within the meaning of section 2(1) of the Sex Discrimination Ordinance (Cap. 480),

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the proceeds of the offer will be applied towards the objectives of the charitable institution or trust, or educational establishment, as the case may be; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the offer contains a statement specified in Part 3 of the Eighteenth Schedule to this Ordinance.

section.name: s10
section.leadIn: An offer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: to members, or applicants for membership, of a club or association—

subparagraph.content: who can reasonably be regarded as having a common interest with each other and with the club or association in the affairs of the club or association; and
where the proceeds of the offer are to be applied for purposes which can reasonably be regarded as concerning the affairs of the club or association; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: containing a statement specified in Part 3 of the Eighteenth Schedule to this Ordinance.

section.name: s11
section.leadIn: An offer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in respect of—

subparagraph.content: an exchange of shares in the same company which does not result in an increase in the issued share capital of the company; or
an exchange of debentures of the same company which does not result in an increase in the aggregate principal amount outstanding under the debentures; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: containing a statement specified in Part 3 of the Eighteenth Schedule to this Ordinance.

section.name: s12
section.leadIn: An offer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in connection with a collective investment scheme authorized under section 104 of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in connection with which the issue of each advertisement, invitation or document has been authorized under section 105 of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571).

part.name: P2
part.heading: Amount Specified for the Purposes of Section 3 of Part 1

part.name: P3
part.heading: Amount Specified for the Purposes of Section 4 of Part 1

part.name: P4
part.heading: Interpretation of Part 1

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: Any reference to an offer in Part 1—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: includes an offer of any right, option or interest in or in relation to the shares or debentures the subject of the offer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not include the offer to the extent that it is made to persons who are outside Hong Kong.

section.name: s2
section.content: A prospectus, notice, circular, brochure, advertisement, or other document, still falls within Part 1 if it falls entirely within any combination of any of sections 1, 2, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11 or 12 of Part 1.

section.name: s3
section.leadIn: For the purposes of sections 2 and 3 of Part 1, an offer is to be taken together with any other offer of the same class of shares or debentures—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which was made by the same person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which was open at any time within the period of 12 months ending with the date on which the first-mentioned offer is first made; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the document issued in respect of which was not a prospectus by virtue of either of those sections being satisfied.

section.name: s4
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 2 of Part 1—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the making of such an offer to any other 2 or more persons jointly,

section.continued: is to be treated as the making of an offer to a single person.

section.name: s5
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 7 of Part 1, a holder of shares in a company, in relation to an offer mentioned in that section, means a person who, at the close of business on a date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specified in the offer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: falling within the period of 60 days ending with the date on which the offer is first made,

section.continued: is a holder of shares in the company.

section.name: s6
section.leadIn: For the purposes of this section and section 8 of Part 1—

def.name: QualifyingPerson
def.leadIn: qualifying person (合資格的人), in relation to a company—

subparagraph.name: A
B
subparagraph.content: a bona fide dependent of any person mentioned in sub-subparagraph (A);

subparagraph.leadIn: includes the trustees of a trust—

subparagraph.name: A
B
subparagraph.content: which can hold shares or debentures on behalf of any person referred to in subparagraph (i);

def.name: Consultant
def.leadIn: consultant (顧問) means a person who, pursuant to a contract for services, renders services to a company (the relevant company) which are commonly rendered by an employee of—

subparagraph.content: the relevant company; or

def.name: Dependent
def.leadIn: dependent (受養人), in relation to a person, means—

subparagraph.content: the wife, husband, widow or widower of the person; or
any child, or stepchild, of the person under the age of 18 years.

section.name: s7
section.content: The Commission may prepare and publish guidelines in relation to the provisions of this Schedule.

section.name: s8
section.content: Guidelines published under section 7 are not subsidiary legislation.

schedule.name: sch18
schedule.heading: Warning, etc. Statements to Be Contained in Certain Documents

part.name: P1
part.heading: Statement to Be Contained in Prospectus to which Section 38(1) of this Ordinance Applies
part.content:
and, if in the Chinese language, a statement in the following form or a form to the like effect—
“重要提示
如你對此招股章程的任何內容有任何疑問，你應尋求獨立專業意見。”.

part.name: P2
part.heading: Statement to Be Contained in Prospectus to which Section 342(1) of this Ordinance Applies
part.content:
and, if in the Chinese language, a statement in the following form or a form to the like effect—
“重要提示
如你對此招股章程的任何內容有任何疑問，你應尋求獨立專業意見。”.

part.name: P3
part.heading: Statement to Be Contained in Certain Offers Specified in Part 1 of the Seventeenth Schedule
part.content: and, if in the Chinese language, a statement in the following form or a form to the like effect—

quotedStructure.content: 本文件的內容未經在香港的規管當局審核。你應就有關要約謹慎行事。如你對本文件的任何內容有任何疑問，你應尋求獨立專業意見。”.

part.name: P4
part.heading: Statement to Be Contained in Issue Prospectus, etc. Mentioned in the Twenty-first Schedule
part.content:
A statement, in a prominent position, if in the English language, in the following form or a form to the like effect—
“Potential investors should read the issue prospectus in conjunction with the programme prospectus to which it relates in order to understand the offer to which the documents relate, in particular before making an application in response to the offer.”;
and, if in the Chinese language, a statement in the following form or a form to the like effect—

content.quotedText: “潛在投資者應參閱發行章程並一併參閱與其相關的計劃章程，以明白該文件所關乎的要約，你尤其應該在應有關要約提出申請前參閱上述文件。”.

part.name: P5
part.heading: Statement to Be Contained in Amendment to Issue Prospectus Mentioned in the Twenty-first Schedule
part.content:
A statement, in a prominent position, if in the English language, in the following form or a form to the like effect—
“Potential investors should read this amendment in conjunction with the issue prospectus which it amends in order to understand the offer to which the documents relate, in particular before making an application in response to the offer.”;
and, if in the Chinese language, a statement in the following form or a form to the like effect—

content.quotedText: “潛在投資者應參閱本修訂並一併參閱被修訂的發行章程，以明白該文件所關乎的要約，你尤其應該在應有關要約提出申請前參閱上述文件。”.

schedule.name: sch19
schedule.heading: Contents and Publication Requirements of Advertisements Mentioned in Section 38B(2)(e) of this Ordinance
schedule.sourceNote: (Nineteenth Schedule added 30 of 2004 s. 2. Amended 14 of 2025 s. 113)

section.name: s1
section.heading: Contents of advertisement

subsection.leadIn: The advertisement must contain the following mandatory particulars or particulars to the like effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a statement that the advertisement is issued by the company to which the advertisement relates;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a warning statement that potential investors should read the prospectus for detailed information about the company and the proposed offering before deciding whether or not to invest in the shares or debentures concerned; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a statement that the advertisement does not constitute an offer or an invitation to induce an offer by any person to acquire, subscribe for or purchase the shares or debentures concerned.

subsection.leadIn: The advertisement may contain the following discretionary particulars but, subject to section 38B(2AA) of this Ordinance, no other discretionary particulars—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the company to which the advertisement relates, the place of incorporation of the company, and if the company has, after its incorporation, changed its place of domicile on one or more occasions, its place of domicile on each occasion; (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 113)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a description of the shares or debentures offered or proposed to be offered;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the dates on which, and the places at which, the prospectus to which the advertisement relates is or will be available to the public;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: details of the administrative procedures relevant to investors that are likely to assist their participation in the offer;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: if a listing is being applied for in Hong Kong or elsewhere, a statement that the company is seeking listing of, and permission to deal in, the shares or debentures concerned on the stock exchange or stock exchanges concerned; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: legends designed to clarify the legal nature of the advertisement if, but only if, the legends are consistent with—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the advertisement not being a prospectus; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: guidelines published under section 38BA of this Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Language
section.content: The advertisement may be in the English language or the Chinese language or both languages.

schedule.name: sch21

part.name: P1
part.heading: Prospectus to which the Provisions of Part II of this Ordinance Apply

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: relevant information (有關資料), in relation to a prospectus, means such information as is required by the provisions of sections 37 to 44B of, and the Third Schedule to, this Ordinance to be contained in the prospectus.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Prospectus consisting of more than one document

subsection.leadIn: A prospectus may consist of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a document containing such relevant information as the issuer of the document thinks fit (but excluding the price, or any formula for calculating the price, of the shares or debentures to which the prospectus relates); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a document, or series of documents, containing such relevant information as is not already contained in the document mentioned in paragraph (a).

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that an issue prospectus does not have to be issued at the same time as the programme prospectus concerned is issued.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Amendments
section.leadIn: The information contained in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a programme prospectus may only be amended by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an addendum to the programme prospectus;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: replacing the programme prospectus with a new programme prospectus; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the issue prospectus concerned or an addendum to the issue prospectus;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: an issue prospectus may only be amended by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an addendum to the issue prospectus; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: replacing the issue prospectus with a new issue prospectus;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: an addendum to a programme prospectus may only be amended by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a further addendum to the programme prospectus;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: replacing the addendum with a new addendum;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: replacing the addendum and programme prospectus with a new programme prospectus; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the issue prospectus concerned or an addendum to the issue prospectus;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: an addendum to an issue prospectus may only be amended by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: replacing the addendum with a new addendum; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: replacing the addendum and issue prospectus with a new issue prospectus.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Amendment made pursuant to section 3 is prospectus
section.content: It is hereby declared that any amendment made pursuant to section 3 is a prospectus and, subject to section 5, the provisions of this Ordinance shall apply to the amendment accordingly.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Certain amendments made pursuant to section 3 to be read with other related documents
section.content: Where it enables a provision of this Ordinance (including paragraph 3 of the Third Schedule to this Ordinance) to apply to an amendment made pursuant to section 3, the amendment shall, for the purposes of that application, be read with all or any of the programme prospectus to which it relates and the addenda, if any, to the programme prospectus and the issue prospectus to which it relates and the addenda, if any, to the issue prospectus, as the case requires.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Warning

subsection.content: Every issue prospectus (including a new issue prospectus mentioned in section 3(b)(ii) or (d)(ii)) and any form of application must contain a statement specified in Part 4 of the Eighteenth Schedule to this Ordinance.
Any amendment made pursuant to section 3(b)(i) must contain a statement specified in Part 5 of the Eighteenth Schedule to this Ordinance.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Availability of programme prospectus, etc.
section.leadIn: The issuer of a programme prospectus must make arrangements for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the programme prospectus and its addenda, if any; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the issue prospectus concerned and its addenda, if any,

section.continued: to be readily available to investors and potential investors throughout the period during which the shares or debentures to which the issue prospectus relates are offered or sold to the public.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Cessation of offer to which programme prospectus, etc. relates
section.leadIn: The shares or debentures the subject of a programme prospectus and its addenda, if any, and the issue prospectus concerned and its addenda, if any, shall cease to be offered or sold to the public on and after the date of—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the first anniversary of the date of publication of the programme prospectus; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if there is a guarantor corporation, within the meaning of section 38(8) of this Ordinance, in relation to the offer concerned, the publication of the next annual report and financial statements of the guarantor corporation after the publication of the programme prospectus,

section.name: s9
section.heading: Application of section 38C of this Ordinance
section.content: It is hereby declared that, where section 38C of this Ordinance has been complied with in respect of a programme prospectus which has been issued, the issue of any issue prospectus concerned does not of itself require that section to again be complied with in respect of the programme prospectus.
