schedule.name: sch22
schedule.heading: Persons Specified for the Purposes of Section 40 of this Ordinance

section.name: s1
section.content: Persons who subscribe for or purchase shares or debentures pursuant to an offer in a prospectus.

section.name: s2
section.content: Persons who by means of an agent acquire shares or debentures pursuant to an offer in a prospectus.

section.name: s3
section.leadIn: Persons who acquire shares or debentures pursuant to arrangements made between—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the issuer or vendor of the shares or debentures; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: intermediaries appointed for the purposes of the offer.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of the provisions specified under section 2B(3) of this Ordinance and this Schedule—
subsection.def: parent company (母公司) means a parent undertaking which is a company;
parent undertaking (母企業) shall be construed in accordance with section 2;

def.name: Shares
def.leadIn: shares (股、股份) shall be construed as a reference to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to an undertaking with a share capital, the allotted shares;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to an undertaking without any capital, the interest—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: conferring any right to share in the profits or liability to contribute to the losses of the undertaking; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: giving rise to an obligation to contribute to the debts or expenses of the undertaking in the event of a winding up;

def.name: Undertaking
def.leadIn: undertaking (企業) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a body corporate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a partnership; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an unincorporated association carrying on a trade or business, whether for profit or not.

subsection.content: In construing any references to an undertaking which is not a company for the purposes of this Ordinance, other expressions appropriate to companies shall be construed, in relation to that undertaking, as references to the corresponding persons, officers, documents or organs, as the case may be, appropriate to undertakings of that description.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Parent undertaking and subsidiary undertaking

subsection.leadIn: An undertaking is a parent undertaking (parent undertaking) in relation to another undertaking (subsidiary undertaking) if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case where both the parent undertaking and the subsidiary undertaking are bodies corporate, the subsidiary undertaking is a subsidiary of the parent undertaking by virtue of section 2(4), (5), (6) and (7) of this Ordinance; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: in any other case, the parent undertaking—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: holds a majority of the voting rights in the subsidiary undertaking;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: is a member of the subsidiary undertaking and has the right to appoint or remove a majority of its board of directors; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: is a member of the subsidiary undertaking and controls alone, pursuant to an agreement with other shareholders or members, a majority of the voting rights in the subsidiary undertaking; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the parent undertaking has the right to exercise a dominant influence over the subsidiary undertaking by virtue of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the provisions contained in any document constituting or regulating the subsidiary undertaking; or (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a control contract.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(a)(ii), an undertaking shall be treated as a member of another undertaking (the relevant undertaking), if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any of its subsidiary undertakings is a member of the relevant undertaking; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any shares in the relevant undertaking are held by a person acting on behalf of the first-mentioned undertaking or any of its subsidiary undertakings.

subsection.content: An undertaking shall be treated as the parent undertaking of another undertaking if a subsidiary undertaking of the first-mentioned undertaking is, or is to be treated as, the parent undertaking of that other undertaking; and references to a subsidiary undertaking of the first-mentioned undertaking shall be construed accordingly.
Sections 3 to 10 contain provisions explaining expressions used in this section and otherwise supplementing this section.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Voting rights in undertaking

subsection.content: For the purposes of section 2(1)(a)(ii)(A) and (C), the references to the voting rights in an undertaking shall be construed as references to the rights conferred on shareholders in respect of their shares or, in the case of an undertaking not having a share capital, on members, to vote at general meetings of the undertaking on all, or substantially all, matters.

For the purposes of subsection (1), where an undertaking which does not have general meetings at which matters are decided by the exercise of voting rights, the references to holding a majority of the voting rights in the undertaking shall be construed as references to having the right under the constitution of the undertaking to direct the overall policy of the undertaking or to alter the terms of its constitution.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Right to appoint or remove majority of directors
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 2(1)(a)(ii)(B)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the reference to the right to appoint or remove a majority of the board of directors shall be construed as a reference to the right to appoint or remove directors holding a majority of the voting rights at meetings of the board on all, or substantially all, matters;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: an undertaking shall be treated as having the right to appoint to a directorship if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a person’s appointment to it follows necessarily from his appointment as a director of the undertaking; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the directorship is held by the undertaking itself; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a right to appoint or remove a directorship which is exercisable only with the consent of another person shall be left out of account unless no other person has a right to appoint or, as the case may be, remove in relation to that directorship.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Right to exercise dominant influence
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 2(1)(b)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an undertaking shall not be regarded as having the right to exercise a dominant influence over another undertaking unless it has a right to give directions with respect to the operating and financial policies of that other undertaking which the directors are, or a majority of the directors is, obliged to comply with whether or not they are for the benefit of that other undertaking; and

def.name: ControlContract
def.leadIn: a control contract (控制合約) means a contract in writing conferring such a right which is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: of a kind authorized by any document constituting or regulating the undertaking in relation to which the right is exercisable; and (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: unless sub-subparagraph (B) applies—the law under which that undertaking is established; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: if that undertaking has changed its place of domicile after its establishment—the law of the latest place of domicile of that undertaking. (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 115)

section.name: s6
section.heading: Rights exercisable only in certain circumstances

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Schedule but without prejudice to subsection (2), rights which are exercisable only in certain circumstances shall be taken into account only—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: when the circumstances have arisen, and for so long as they continue to obtain; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: when the circumstances are within the control of the person having the rights.

subsection.content: Rights which are normally exercisable but are temporarily incapable of exercise shall continue to be taken into account.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Rights held by one person on behalf of another
section.leadIn: For the purposes of this Schedule—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: rights held by a person in a fiduciary capacity shall be treated as not held by him;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: rights held by a person as nominee for another shall be treated as held by the other; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: rights shall be treated as held as nominee for another if they are exercisable only on his instructions or with his consent.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Rights attached to shares by way of security
section.leadIn: Where any rights referred to in this Schedule are attached to shares held by way of security, the rights shall be treated as held by the person providing the security, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: apart from the right to exercise them for the purpose of preserving the value of the security, or of realizing it, the rights are exercisable only in accordance with his instructions; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the shares are held in connection with the granting of loans as part of normal business activities and apart from the right to exercise them for the purpose of preserving the value of the security, or of realizing it, the rights are exercisable only in his interests.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Rights attributed to parent undertaking

subsection.content: For the purposes of section 2, rights shall be treated as held by a parent undertaking if they are held by any of its subsidiary undertakings.
Nothing in section 7 or 8 shall be construed as requiring rights held by a parent undertaking to be treated as held by any of its subsidiary undertakings.

For the purposes of section 8, rights shall be treated as being exercisable in accordance with the instructions of or in the interests of an undertaking if they are exercisable in accordance with the instructions of or, as the case may be, in the interests of any group undertaking.

def.name: GroupUndertaking
def.leadIn: In this section, group undertaking (企業集團), in relation to an undertaking (relevant undertaking), means an undertaking which is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a parent undertaking or subsidiary undertaking of the relevant undertaking; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a subsidiary undertaking of any parent undertaking of the relevant undertaking.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Supplementary
section.content: References in any provision of sections 7, 8 and 9 to rights held by a person include rights falling to be treated as held by him by virtue of any other provision of those sections but not rights which by virtue of any such provision are to be treated as not held by him.

schedule.name: sch25
schedule.heading: Powers of liquidator in winding up

section.name: s1
section.content: Pay a class of creditors in full.

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: Make a compromise or arrangement with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: creditors or persons claiming to be creditors; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: persons having or alleging themselves to have any claim (present or future, certain or contingent, ascertained or sounding only in damages) against the company, or for which the company may be rendered liable.

section.name: s3
section.leadIn: To—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: compromise, on such terms as are agreed—

subparagraph.leadIn: calls and liabilities to calls, debts, and liabilities capable of resulting in debts, and claims (present or future, certain or contingent, ascertained or sounding only in damages) subsisting or supposed to subsist between the company and—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a contributory;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: an alleged contributory; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: any other debtor or person apprehending liability to the company; and
questions in any way relating to or affecting the assets or the winding up of the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take any security for the discharge of any call, debt, liability or claim, and give a complete discharge in respect of it.

section.name: s1
section.content: Bring or defend any action or other legal proceedings in the name and on behalf of the company.

section.name: s2
section.content: Carry on the business of the company, so far as may be necessary for its beneficial winding up.

section.name: s1
section.content: Sell the real and personal property and things in action of the company by public auction or private contract, with power to transfer the whole of the property and things in action to any person or company, or to sell them in parcels.

section.name: s2
section.content: Do all acts and execute, in the name and on behalf of the company, all deeds, receipts and other documents, and for that purpose use, when necessary, the company’s seal.

section.name: s3
section.content: Prove, rank, and claim in the bankruptcy, insolvency, or sequestration of any contributory, for any balance against the contributory’s estate, and receive dividends in the bankruptcy, insolvency, or sequestration in respect of that balance, as a separate debt due from the bankrupt or insolvent, and rateably with the other separate creditors.

section.name: s4
section.content: Draw, accept, make, and endorse any bill of exchange or promissory note in the name and on behalf of the company, with the same effect with respect to the liability of the company as if the bill or note had been drawn, accepted, made, or endorsed by or on behalf of the company in the course of its business.

section.name: s5
section.content: Raise on the security of the assets of the company any money requisite.

section.name: s6
section.content: Take out in the official name of the liquidator letters of administration to any deceased contributory, and do in the official name of the liquidator any other act necessary for obtaining payment of any money due from a contributory or the estate of the contributory that cannot be conveniently done in the name of the company. In all such cases the money due is deemed, for the purpose of enabling the liquidator to take out the letters of administration or recover the money, to be due to the liquidator.

section.name: s7
section.content: Appoint an agent to do any business that the liquidator is unable to do in person.

section.name: s8
section.content: Employ a solicitor to assist the liquidator in performing the liquidator’s duties.

section.name: s9
section.content: Do all other things as may be necessary for winding up the affairs of the company and distributing its assets.

schedule.name: sch26
schedule.heading: Transitional and Saving Provisions Relating to Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) (Amendment) Ordinance 2016

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Schedule—
section.def: commencement date (生效日期) means the date of commencement of the Amendment Ordinance;

former (原有), when it appears in conjunction with a reference to a section described by a number or a combination of a number and a letter, means the provision of the former Ordinance that is referred to as a section described by that number or that combination of number and letter;
former Ordinance (《原有條例》) means this Ordinance as in force immediately before the commencement date;
former Rules (《原有規則》) means the Winding-up Rules as in force immediately before the commencement date;
Winding-up Rules (《清盤規則》) means the Companies (Winding-up) Rules (Cap. 32 sub. leg. H).

section.name: s2
section.heading: Public examination under section 168IA

subsection.content: This section applies where, before the commencement date, an application has been made under the former section 168IA for the court to exercise any of its powers under that section.

subsection.leadIn: The following provisions and forms continue to apply in relation to the proceedings and examination arising from the application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the former section 168IA; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: rules 52, 57 and 57A of, and Forms 29, 30, 31, 38 and 38A in the Appendix to, the former Rules.

subsection.leadIn: The following provisions do not apply in relation to the proceedings and examination arising from the application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sections 168IB and 286E; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: rule 51B of the Winding-up Rules.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Liability to contribute under section 170A
section.content: Section 170A does not apply in relation to a payment out of capital in respect of the redemption or buy-back of a company’s own shares that has taken place before the commencement date.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Demand to pay debts under section 178(1)(a)
section.content: If a demand was served under the former section 178(1)(a) before the commencement date, the demand continues to have effect on and after the commencement date as if that former section had not been amended by the Amendment Ordinance.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Statement of affairs required under section 190
section.leadIn: If the petition for the winding up of a company has been presented before the commencement date, then in relation to the winding up and the appointment of a provisional liquidator in connection with the petition—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the following provisions continue to apply—

subparagraph.content: the former section 190; and
rules 39, 40, 41, 42, 43 and 44 of the former Rules; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 190A does not apply.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Case where former sections 193, 194 and 196 apply
section.leadIn: If the petition for the winding up of a company has been presented before the commencement date, then in relation to the winding up—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the former sections 193, 194 and 196(1), (1A), (2), (2A), (3) and (4) continue to apply; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sections 193(4), (5), (6) and (7), 194(1)(da) and (6) and 196(1B) do not apply.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Powers of liquidators under section 199
section.leadIn: If the petition for the winding up of a company has been presented before the commencement date, then in relation to the winding up—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the former section 199 continues to apply; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sections 199A and 199B and Schedule 25 do not apply.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Release of liquidators under section 205
section.content: For a liquidator appointed before the commencement date, section 205(3)(a) does not apply in relation to the release of the liquidator.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Meetings of creditors and contributories to consider appointment of committee of inspection; constitution of committee of inspection

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), if the winding up of a company has commenced before the commencement date, the former sections 206 and 207(1) continue to apply in relation to the winding up of the company.

Subject to section 11(2) of this Schedule, section 206(6) applies in relation to the membership of, and representation at a meeting of, a committee of inspection, irrespective of when the winding up of the company commenced.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Proceedings of committee of inspection

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2), (3) and (4), sections 206A and 207 apply in relation to the proceedings of a committee of inspection, irrespective of when the winding up of the company commenced.

subsection.leadIn: In respect of a committee of inspection appointed before the commencement date, if the first meeting of the committee has not been held before that date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the former section 207(2) continues to apply in relation to the first meeting of the committee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 206A(2) does not apply in relation to that committee.

subsection.leadIn: If the winding up of a company has commenced before the commencement date, then in relation to the proceedings of the committee of inspection—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the former section 207(7) continues to apply; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 207(7A) and (7B) does not apply.

subsection.content: If the winding up of a company has commenced before the commencement date, the former section 207(8) continues to apply in relation to the proceedings of the committee of inspection.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Representatives of members of committee of inspection

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), section 207A applies in relation to the representatives of the members of a committee of inspection, irrespective of when the winding up of the company commenced.

subsection.leadIn: If a member of the committee of inspection has validly appointed a representative before the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 207A(1), (2), (3) and (5) does not operate to invalidate the appointment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 207A(4), (6) and (7) does not apply to the representative.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Remote attendance and written resolutions of meeting of committee of inspection, etc.
section.content: Sections 207B, 207C, 207D, 207E, 207F, 207G, 207H, 207I, 207J and 207K apply in relation to the proceedings of a committee of inspection, irrespective of when the winding up of the company commenced.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Travelling expenses of members of committee of inspection or representatives of members

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), section 207L applies in relation to the travelling expenses of a member of a committee of inspection or the representative of a member referred to in that section, irrespective of when the winding up of the company commenced.
Section 207L does not apply to any expenses incurred before the commencement date.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Examination under former section 221

subsection.leadIn: This section applies where, before the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application has been made pursuant to the former section 221 for the court to exercise any of its powers under that section; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the court has exercised any of its powers under the former section 221.

subsection.leadIn: The following provisions continue to apply in relation to the proceedings and examination arising from the application or exercise of power—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the former sections 221 and 222A; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: rules 5(2), 62 and 206 of the former Rules.

subsection.leadIn: The following provisions and forms do not apply in relation to the proceedings and examination arising from the application or exercise of power—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sections 286B, 286C, 286D and 286E; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: rules 58A and 58B of, and Forms 38B and 38C in the Appendix to, the Winding-up Rules.

subsection.content: Section 360G applies for the purposes of the application or exercise of power as if the references to sections 286B, 286C and 286D in it were a reference to the former section 221.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Public examination under former section 222

subsection.content: This section applies where, before the commencement date, an application has been made under rule 50 of the former Rules to fix a day for the consideration of a report submitted under section 191(2).

subsection.leadIn: The following provisions and forms continue to apply in relation to the proceedings and examination arising from the application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the former sections 191, 222 and 222A; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: rules 52, 57 and 59 of, and Forms 29, 30, 31, 38 and 38A in the Appendix to, the former Rules.

subsection.leadIn: The following provisions do not apply in relation to the proceedings and examination arising from the application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sections 286A, 286D and 286E; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: rules 51A and 51B of the Winding-up Rules.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Regulating order under section 227A, etc.

subsection.content: If the petition for the winding up of a company has been presented before the commencement date, the former sections 227A, 227B and 227E continue to apply in relation to that winding up.

subsection.leadIn: If the petition for the winding up of a company is presented on or after the commencement date, but the winding up has commenced before that date, section 227B(2) applies as if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the reference to section 206(1) and (2) in it were a reference to the former section 206(1) and (2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reference to section 207(6), (7), (7A) and (7B) in it were a reference to the former section 207(6) and (7).

section.name: s17
section.heading: Voluntary winding up under former section 228(1)(c)

subsection.leadIn: If a company has passed a special resolution under the former section 228(1)(c) before the commencement date, then—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the former section 228(1) continues to apply in relation to the winding up; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the winding up of the company, the expression a resolution for voluntary winding up continues to have the meaning given by the former section 228(2).

subsection.leadIn: No resolution for voluntary winding up of a company may be passed on or after the commencement date under the former section 228(1)(c) even if, before the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notices of the meeting to consider the resolution have been sent to members of the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the relevant written resolution has been circulated among the members.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Voluntary winding up under section 228A

subsection.leadIn: If the winding up of a company has commenced before the commencement date, then—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to subsections (2) and (3), the former section 228A and the provisions in the Twelfth Schedule to the former Ordinance relating to that section continue to apply; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 228B and the provisions in the Twelfth Schedule relating to section 228B do not apply.

subsection.content: Section 228A(11) applies if a provisional liquidator appointed under the former section 228A(5)(b) ceases to act as such on or after the commencement date.
Section 228A(12) applies to a notice of appointment delivered under the former section 228A(10) if, on or after the commencement date, any change occurs in the particulars in that notice.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Notice of resolution to wind up voluntarily under section 229
section.content: If a company has passed a resolution for voluntary winding up under the former section 228 before the commencement date, the former section 229 continues to apply in relation to the company’s obligation to give notice of the resolution.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Cases where former section 237A and related provisions apply

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a members’ voluntary winding up has commenced before the commencement date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subsequently, the liquidator of the company is of the opinion that the company will not be able to pay its debts in full within the period stated in the certificate or declaration mentioned in the former section 237A.

subsection.leadIn: In relation to the winding up—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: sections 237B and 240(2) do not apply;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the former section 239A continues to apply; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: section 240(1) is to be read as if it is not subject to section 240(2).

section.name: s21
section.heading: Provisions relating to liquidators where former section 237A applies

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a members’ voluntary winding up commenced before the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to which the former section 237A applies because of section 20 of this Schedule; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in respect of which a meeting of the creditors summoned by the liquidator under the former section 237A is held on or after the commencement date.

subsection.leadIn: If the person holding the office of liquidator of the company is disqualified under section 262B(3) from acting as liquidator of the company, then—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: despite sections 262A and 262B and rule 155 of the Winding-up Rules, the person may continue to act as liquidator of the company until the meeting is concluded, but solely for the purposes of complying with the former section 237A; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: immediately after the conclusion of the meeting, the person ceases to be the liquidator of the company and for the purposes of this Ordinance, the Winding-up Rules and the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) is taken to have been removed from that office.

subsection.leadIn: Sections 262A, 262B, 262C, 262D, 262E, 262F and 262G and the provisions in the Twelfth Schedule relating to those sections apply in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the appointment of a liquidator made at a meeting of creditors held under the former section 237A(2) if notices of the meeting are sent on or after the commencement date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the liquidator appointed at that meeting.

subsection.leadIn: The former section 278 continues to apply and sections 262A, 262B, 262C, 262D, 262E, 262F and 262G and the provisions in the Twelfth Schedule relating to those sections do not apply in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the appointment of a liquidator made at a meeting of creditors held under the former section 237A(2) if notices of the meeting have been sent before the commencement date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the liquidator appointed at that meeting.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Provisions applicable to creditors’ voluntary winding up (former section 241 and section 243A)
section.leadIn: If notices of a meeting of the company at which a resolution for voluntary winding up is to be proposed have been sent before the commencement date and the winding up is intended to be a creditors’ voluntary winding up—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the former section 241 continues to apply in relation to the meeting of creditors of the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 243A and the provisions in the Twelfth Schedule relating to that section do not apply in relation to the powers and duties of a person nominated by the company to be liquidator in that winding up.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Appointment of committee of inspection

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), if the winding up of a company has commenced before the commencement date, the former section 243 continues to apply in relation to the winding up of the company.

Without limiting sections 10, 11, 12 and 13 of this Schedule, section 243(2) applies in relation to a committee of inspection appointed in a creditors’ voluntary winding up, irrespective of when the winding up of the company commenced.

Subject to section 11(2) of this Schedule, section 243(3) applies in relation to the membership of, and representation at a meeting of, a committee of inspection, irrespective of when the winding up of the company commenced.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Removal of liquidator under section 244A
section.content: Section 244A does not apply to a liquidator appointed before the commencement date.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Directors’ powers before nomination or appointment of liquidator under section 250A

subsection.leadIn: This section applies where—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the resolution is passed at the meeting, irrespective of when the meeting is held.

subsection.content: Section 250A and the provision in the Twelfth Schedule relating to that section do not apply in relation to the directors’ powers before nomination or appointment of liquidator in the winding up.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Powers and duties of liquidator in voluntary winding up under section 251
section.leadIn: In a voluntary winding up, if the winding up has commenced before the commencement date, then in relation to the powers and duties of the liquidator in that winding up—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the former section 251 continues to apply; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Schedule 25 does not apply.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Notice by liquidator of appointment or ceasing to act under section 253

subsection.content: If a liquidator was appointed before the commencement date, the liquidator is to comply with the requirements under the former section 253(1).
If a person appointed as liquidator has ceased to act before the commencement date, the person is to comply with the requirements under the former section 253(2).

If, before the commencement date, a change has occurred in the particulars given in a notice delivered to the Registrar under the former section 253(1)(b), the liquidator is to comply with the requirements under the former section 253(3).

To avoid doubt, section 253 does not apply to a provisional liquidator appointed under the former section 228A(5)(b), just as the former section 253 did not apply to a provisional liquidator appointed under the former section 228A(5)(b).

section.name: s28
section.heading: Audit of liquidator’s accounts in voluntary winding up

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), section 255A(2) applies in relation to the liquidator’s accounts, irrespective of when the winding up of the company commenced.
If a resolution has been passed in accordance with the former section 255A(2) before the commencement date, that section continues to apply in relation to the liquidator’s account.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Application of former sections 196(5) and 278 to liquidators and their appointment

subsection.leadIn: The former sections 196(5) and 278 (and the provision in the Twelfth Schedule to the former Ordinance relating to the former section 278) continue to apply and sections 262A, 262B, 262C, 262D, 262E, 262F and 262G (and the provisions in the Twelfth Schedule relating to sections 262A, 262B, 262C, 262D, 262E, 262F and 262G) do not apply in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the appointment of a liquidator—

subparagraph.content: made before the commencement date;
to be made at a meeting held on or after the commencement date but notices of the meeting have been sent before that date; or
to be made by the court on or after the commencement date in response to an application made before that date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a liquidator appointed—

subparagraph.content: before the commencement date;
at a meeting mentioned in paragraph (a)(ii); or
by the court in response to an application mentioned in paragraph (a)(iii).

subsection.leadIn: Sections 262A, 262B, 262C, 262D, 262E, 262F and 262G and the provisions in the Twelfth Schedule relating to those sections do not apply in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the appointment of a provisional liquidator—

subparagraph.content: made before the commencement date;
to be made at a meeting held on or after the commencement date but notices of the meeting have been sent before that date; or
to be made by the court on or after the commencement date in response to an application made before that date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a provisional liquidator appointed—

subparagraph.content: before the commencement date;
at a meeting mentioned in paragraph (a)(ii); or
by the court in response to an application mentioned in paragraph (a)(iii).

subsection.leadIn: Sections 262A, 262B, 262C, 262D, 262E, 262F and 262G and the provisions in the Twelfth Schedule relating to those sections do not apply in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the nomination for appointment of a liquidator—

subparagraph.content: made before the commencement date; or
to be made at a meeting held on or after the commencement date but notices of the meeting have been sent before that date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a liquidator nominated for appointment—

subparagraph.content: before the commencement date; or
at a meeting mentioned in paragraph (a)(ii).

section.name: s30
section.heading: Effect of transactions at an undervalue, unfair preferences and floating charges (sections 265A to 267A)

subsection.leadIn: Sections 265A, 265B and 265C do not apply in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a transaction at an undervalue entered into by a company before the commencement date;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an unfair preference given by a company before the commencement date; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a charge created on the undertaking or property of a company before the commencement date.

subsection.content: Section 265D does not apply in relation to a transaction at an undervalue entered into by a company before the commencement date.

Sections 266 and 266A do not apply in relation to anything done or suffered to be done by a company before the commencement date, and the former sections 266, 266A and 266B continue to apply in relation to that thing.

subsection.leadIn: Sections 266B, 266C and 266D do not apply in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a transaction at an undervalue entered into by a company before the commencement date; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an unfair preference given by a company before the commencement date.

subsection.content: Sections 267 and 267A do not apply in relation to a charge created on the undertaking or property of a company before the commencement date, and the former section 267 continues to apply in relation to the charge.

subsection.leadIn: Section 360G applies—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purposes of anything done or suffered to be done by a company before the commencement date, as if the references to sections 265A, 265B, 265C, 266, 266A, 266B, 266C and 266D in it were references to the former sections 266, 266A and 266B; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the purposes of a charge created on the undertaking or property of a company before the commencement date, as if the references to sections 265A, 265B, 265C, 267 and 267A in it were a reference to the former section 267.

subsection.content: In paragraph 3 of Part II of the Fifteenth Schedule, the reference to section 266 includes the former section 266.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Liability for not keeping proper records under section 274

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: record keeping period (存檔期), in relation to a company being wound up, means the shorter of the following periods—(a)the period of 2 years immediately preceding the commencement of the winding up;(b)the period between the incorporation of the company and the commencement of the winding up.

subsection.content: If the winding up of a company commences before the expiry of the period of 2 years beginning on the first day of the company’s first financial year that begins on or after the commencement date, section 274 is to have effect as provided in subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2), section 274 is to be read as if, for a part of the record keeping period that coincides (whether in whole or in part) with a financial year of the company that begins before the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: “proper books of accounts” were substituted for “accounting records that comply with section 373(2) and (3) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622)”; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the former section 274(2) had not been repealed.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Power of court to assess damages against delinquent officer, etc. under section 276
section.content: For a person who has acted as a liquidator of a company and who has been released under section 205, section 276(1B) does not apply in relation to an application made under section 276(1) in respect of the person if the person was appointed as liquidator before the commencement date.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Electronic communications by liquidators
section.content: Division 6 of Part V and the provision in the Twelfth Schedule relating to section 296E(7) apply in respect of communications by liquidators to other persons, irrespective of when the winding up of the company commenced.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Demand to pay debts under former section 327(4)(a)
section.content: If a demand was served under the former section 327(4)(a) before the commencement date, the demand continues to have effect on and after the commencement date as if that former section had not been amended by the Amendment Ordinance.
